Baroque.passage: Baroque is a style of art, architecture, and music that originated in Europe in the early 17th century and lasted until the mid-18th century. It is characterized by ornate and theatrical forms, dramatic use of light and shadow, and a sense of movement and tension. Baroque art and architecture often featured grandiose and elaborate designs, with a focus on the use of ornamentation and decoration. The style was heavily influenced by the Catholic Church and the Counter-Reformation, which sought to counter the Protestant Reformation and emphasize the grandeur and power of the Church. Baroque music was characterized by complex and intricate melodies, rich harmonies, and a strong emphasis on emotional expression. Some of the most famous composers of Baroque music include Johann Sebastian Bach, George Frideric Handel, and Antonio Vivaldi.
